newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Ahmsa debt rated MA- by Duff.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Ahmsa debt rated MA- by Duff.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating on Wednesday said it assigned an MA- rating to a $300 million issue of medium-term notes issued by steelmaker Altos Hornos de Mexico.

"Its operating earnings declined (in year-on-year terms in the third quarter of 1996) by 6.7 percent. Despite this, its debt coverage improved from 1.4 times in September 1995 to 1.84 times in September 1996," analysts Marco Sotomayor and Horacio Flores said in a report.

The analysts said Ahmsa's main risks involved the competitive nature of the steel business, as well as the impact of general economic conditions on sales of the company's products and activity in the construction industry in particular.
